class.name: KMLDriver
class.documentation:
This output driver produces output in the KML (Keyhole XML) format. This is the input format for Google Earth (http://earth.google.com) and Google Maps (http://maps.google.com).
The output driver differs much from other drivers, because it describes not only a two-dimensional visualisation but also describes the dimensions of height and time.
See also the parameters for the BaseDriver.

parameter.name: kml_kmz
parameter.documentation: Defines if output files will be zipped into a KMZ file.

parameter.name: kml_author
parameter.documentation: Gives the author of the product.

parameter.name: kml_link
parameter.documentation: Gives the HTTP link to the product (Example: http://www.ecmwf.int/products).

parameter.name: kml_height
parameter.documentation: Default height of all layers! [This is still WORK IN PROGRESS!!!]

parameter.name: kml_latitude
parameter.documentation: Defines the latitude of initial viewpoint.

parameter.name: kml_longitude
parameter.documentation: Defines the longitude of initial viewpoint.

parameter.name: kml_transparency
parameter.documentation: Defines the transparency in percentage ( 0% = invisible) of the layers saved.

parameter.name: kml_tilt
parameter.documentation: Defines the tilting angle for the default view (0 equals from above).

parameter.name: kml_range
parameter.documentation: Defines the distance (km) to the default view in km.

parameter.name: kml_coastlines
parameter.documentation: Determines if coastlines are plotted by Magics or not. Default is OFF because Google Earth and Google Maps have their own coastlines.
